#Text=Name Your Chinchilla
#Text=Chinchillas are cute pets known for their thick , rich coats .
#Text=As with most other types of pet , you can name your chinchilla anything you please .
#Text=If you ’re struggling to come up with a name for your pet , there are different places you can look for inspiration .
#Text=You can name chinchillas after their physical features , the color of their coat , after one of their personality traits .
#Text=If nothing seems to fit , you can just choose a human name and give it to the chinchilla .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Finding Namesakes for Your Chinchilla
#Text=Choose a short name for easier training .
#Text=If you 're planning on training your chinchilla , choose a name that 's not too long or complicated .
#Text=Your chinchilla will probably only recognize the first 1-2 syllables , so a shorter name is always better .
#Text=If you choose a long name , like Penelope , you could shorten it to a nickname , such as Penny .
#Text=Name your chinchilla after their ears .
#Text=Most chinchillas have large , floppy ears that are immediately noticeable .
#Text=In nature , these ears help them hear prey and escape from predators .
#Text=In captivity , however , the ears can lead to funny names for your pet .
#Text=Consider naming your chinchilla :
#Text=Dumbo , from the Disney movie of the same name .
#Text=Gizmo , from the movie Gremlins .
#Text=Despereaux , from the movie The Tale of Despereaux .
#Text=Give the chinchilla the name of a famous mouse .
#Text=Chinchillas are mammals in the rodent family , and as such , they share physical and behavioral traits with many other rodents .
#Text=You could name your chinchilla after any famous pop-culture rodents or creatures who share the same chubby body , large ears , and cute muzzle .
#Text=Mickey ( if it ’s male )
#Text=Minnie ( if it ’s female )
#Text=Jerry , from the Tom and Jerry cartoon
#Text=Pikachu
#Text=Borrow a name from TV , literature , or history .
#Text=Your reading and viewing preferences will put a wealth of names at your fingertips .
#Text=You can name your chinchilla after your favorite character in a book or play , or a popular TV show or movie .
#Text=Not only will this make the name easy to remember , but many of your friends will also know what the name refers to .
#Text=Borrow a name from literature , like Macbeth or Ophelia .
#Text=If you prefer movies or TV , name your chinchilla after a famous character like Buffy , Shirley Temple , or Tinkerbell .
#Text=If you like history , name your chinchilla after a historical figure like Kit Carson , Napoleon , or Lincoln .
#Text=Naming the Chinchilla after Its Fur
#Text=Name the chinchilla “ Dusty . ”
#Text=Chinchillas take dust baths in order to maintain their coat and keep their bodies clean .
#Text=Use this fact when naming your chinchilla ; “ Dusty ” would be a suitable name for either a male or female chinchilla .
#Text=You can name your pet other words that are synonymous to dusty , like “ Sandy . ”
#Text=Create a name based on the color of its coat .
#Text=Chinchillas ’ standard coat color is gray .
#Text=While this may not seem like the most exciting color to base a name off of , there are quite a few words that are synonymous with shades of gray that make good pet names .
#Text=Consider :
#Text=Onyx
#Text=Smokey
#Text=Olive
#Text=Oatmeal
#Text=Find a name for an uncommonly colored chinchilla .
#Text=Decades of breeding practices and mild genetic mutations have led to a large variety in the colors of chinchillas ’ coats .
#Text=Their fur can be a variety of shades of gray , many shades of beige , black ( called “ ebony ” ) , or white .
#Text=If your chinchilla ’s fur has pink or reddish tones , you could name it Rose or Rosie .
#Text=Many chinchillas have a slight blue tint to their fur .
#Text=You could name such a chinchilla Sapphire or just Blue .
#Text=If your chinchilla is black , you could name it Licorice .
#Text=Naming the Chinchilla after its Personality
#Text=Base the chinchilla ’s name on its funny behavior .
#Text=Chinchillas can appear comical because of their large bodies , small faces , and curious nature .
#Text=Pick a name that reflects these aspects of your chinchilla , like : Furry , Floppy , or Fluffy .
#Text=Chinchillas are also naturally acrobatic animals .
#Text=You could name the pet Jumper , as you ’ll often see it leaping around its cage .
#Text=Base your chinchilla ’s name on its nocturnal habits .
#Text=Like many other types of rodent pets ( including hamsters ) , chinchillas are nocturnal .
#Text=This means that your chinchilla will be active primarily at night and spend a large part of the day sleeping .
#Text=Use this to give you ideas for names , including :
#Text=Sleepy
#Text=Grumpy
#Text=Night Owl
#Text=Name your chinchilla “ Chilly ” after their preferred temperature .
#Text=Chinchillas thrive as pets when they ’re kept at cooler temperatures — ideally between 58 and 68°F ( 14.4 and 20°C ) .
#Text=You could also change the spelling and name the chinchilla Chile .
#Text=This is doubly appropriate , since chinchillas are native to the country of Chile .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Avoid choosing an extremely long name ( say , over 12 characters ) for your chinchilla .
#Text=At some point you ’ll have to fill out paperwork for the animal ( e. g. at the vet ’s office ) and the form may not be able to accommodate a very long name .

#Text=Avoid your chinchilla 's name being irrelevant to their physical or internal traits because you may forget it and will have to get your chinchilla used to a new name which could slow down the process of taming and teaching new tricks to your chinchilla .
#Text=Quick Summary
